intro: Syngonanthus gracilis var. pulcher, commonly known as the slender spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its inflorescence consists of racemes of small, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Syngonanthus gracilis var. pulcher is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
